todos.title: Niche
todos.body: Your product should not be for everyone.

todos.title: Spending
todos.body: Where does customer spend money?

todos.title: Advice
todos.body: Where does customer look for advice?

todos.title: Read
todos.body: What does customer read?

todos.title: Customer Sellers
todos.body: Turn customers into sales reps.

todos.title: Motivation triangle
todos.body: There are people feeling pain now, worried, vigilant, and think it’s a cool idea.  Forget the people that think it’s a good idea and start on the people that are really feeling the pain.

todos.title: Smart v Innovative
todos.body: Smart doesn’t always equal innovative.  Innovative is having an idea that touches a nerve with a customer, smart is being able to execute the best possible solution.  Pivot or restart until you have both done solid.

todos.title: Benefit and Reason
todos.body: Sell the benefit and then reason to believe.

todos.title: Don’t Bury Lead
todos.body: Say first what you want people to hear first.

todos.title: Motivation
todos.body: People can be motivated by pain, fear, greed, vanity, embarrassment, etc.

todos.title: Unique and important
todos.body: Is it unique and important to sell.  Air is important but not unique unless you put it in a scuba tank.

todos.title: Money Talks
todos.body: If people aren’t spending money to try to address your problem, its not a real problem.

todos.title: Customer Perspective
todos.body: How does customer view problem?

todos.title: Nerve
todos.body: How do you touch a nerve with your customers.

todos.title: Tip of Iceberg
todos.body: Focus on your bread and butter.  Keep it simple.  You can always say at the end, “this is just the tip of the iceberg.”  There is no hocus-pocus that takes the place of focus.

todos.title: Leverage
todos.body: Find a sales force (people and channels) that sells for you for nothing.

todos.title: Simple stupid
todos.body: Dumb down the language.

todos.title: Confidence/Facts
todos.body: Don’t use words “I believe” or “I think.”

todos.title: Secret sauce
todos.body: Don’t talk methods, keep the secret sauce secret and just talk about the benefits and how you’ve proven your methods work.

todos.title: Leading
todos.body: Don’t ask customers leading questions such as we do this…what are your problems?  They are likely to center their problems around what you do.  Say “I want to run a couple business ideas by you.  I’m not trying to sell something to you and whatever you say isn’t going to let me down.  I think going through this exercise would add value.

todos.title: Ownership
todos.body: Does customer own problem.

todos.title: Money
todos.body: Does customer have money.

todos.title: Five minute pitch
todos.body: Describe your customer in detail, what’s broke, what’s motivating them, how much is it costing them, what they need in a nutshell, and how you can help.

todos.title: Customer Path
todos.body: Constantly be changing your customer definition to the next best customer that will get you where you need to be.  Sometimes it make sense to start small and go big.

todos.title: Vulnerable
todos.body: Be vulnerable.

todos.title: Strategic pause
todos.body: Ask your upfront contract and how you can help your audience and then pause.
